meanings.definition: A period of time during which an event or process takes place.
meanings.sent1: The timescale of the movie was just two hours, making it a quick watch.
meanings.sent2: The geologic timescale spans millions of years.
meanings.sent3: I can't believe how fast the timescale of the meeting was; it felt like it was over in a blink.
meanings.sent4: The timescale of a butterfly's life is like a fleeting moment in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent5: The timescale of a shooting star is so brief, yet it leaves a lasting impression.

meanings.definition: The amount of time taken to complete a process or activity.
meanings.sent1: The timescale for baking cookies is usually around 10-15 minutes.
meanings.sent2: The construction project had a tight timescale to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The timescale for getting ready in the morning can vary depending on how much time you have.
meanings.sent4: She worked diligently to shorten the timescale for completing the assignment.
meanings.sent5: The timescale for a sprinter to finish a race is measured in seconds.
